questions.instructions:
You should spend about 20 minutes on Questions 1 – 10 which are based on Reading Passage 1.

Questions 1 – 4

Label the diagram below using NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS.
questions.question: Complete the diagram labeling (Questions 1-4):
field_labels: 2. Fill in the blank 2 of 10 (build body strength)
3. Fill in the blank 3 of 10 (cope with stress/boost confidence)
questions.correct_feedback: Excellent! You correctly identified all the categories of performance-enhancing drugs.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Review paragraph 3 carefully. Look for sections that describe different types of performance-enhancing drugs and their purposes: stimulants, body-building drugs, relaxants, and pain maskers.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answers are: 1. cocaine (stimulant), 2. anabolic steroids (build body strength), 3. relaxants (cope with stress/boost confidence), 4. mask pain (purpose). These are all mentioned in paragraph 3 of Reading Passage 1.

questions.instructions:
Questions 5 – 8

Answer the following questions using NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS.
questions.question: Answer the questions (Questions 5-8):
field_labels: 5. Why are sportspeople under such pressure to succeed quickly?
6. What has subsequently become necessary in a number of sports?
7. What does Ron Clarke claim drugs can balance?
8. What are drug companies becoming more able to do?
field_answers: drug testing|testing for drugs|drugs test|drugs testing|drug tests
questions.correct_feedback: Well done! You found all the key information in the passage.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Not quite. Read the passage carefully and look for: reasons for pressure on sportspeople, what became necessary in sports, Ron Clarke's view on drugs, and what drug companies can do.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answers are: 5. short careers (paragraph 2), 6. drug testing (paragraph 5), 7. natural advantages (paragraph 6), 8. evade detection (paragraph 5). Review these sections of Reading Passage 1.

questions.instructions:
Questions 9 and 10

Complete the summary using words from the text. USE NO MORE THAN ONE WORD.
questions.question: Complete the summary (Questions 9-10):
field_labels: 9. The main failure of drug testing is its increasing (9) _____
10. (10) _____ of drug use have serious side effects on sportspeople even if they are subsequently proved wrong.
questions.correct_feedback: Correct! You've accurately completed the summary.
questions.incorrect_feedback: Review paragraph 6 which discusses the failures of drug testing and their consequences.
questions.no_answer_feedback: The correct answers are: 9. inaccuracy, 10. allegations. Both words are from paragraph 6 which discusses drug testing problems.
